paper_metadata.title: Hereditary ATTR Amyloidosis in Austria: Prevalence and Epidemiological Hot Spots
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: 12 males and 10 females, predominantly native Austrians
patients.phenotype: predominantly cardiac phenotype with considerable PNP development

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with predominant cardiac phenotype, developed considerable PNP
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All six patients carrying the p.His108Arg mutation initially presented with a predominant cardiac phenotype but developed considerable PNP with disease progression.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with a high penetrance of cardiac and peripheral neuropathy symptoms.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is noted as a mutational hotspot in Austria.
key_quotes: the most common TTR mutation (p.His108Arg) in and around Vienna
All six patients carrying the p.His108Arg mutation initially presented with a predominant cardiac phenotype but developed considerable PNP with disease progression.

patients.demographics: 12 males and 10 females, predominantly native Austrians
patients.phenotype: predominantly cardiac phenotype at disease onset

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with predominant cardiac phenotype
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All three cases with the recurrent p.Val113Leu mutation presented with a predominant cardiac phenotype at disease onset.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with a high penetrance of cardiac symptoms.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is noted as a mutational hotspot in Austria.
key_quotes: the recurrent p.Val113Leu mutation presented with a predominant cardiac phenotype at disease onset.

patients.demographics: 12 males and 10 females, predominantly native Austrians

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with hereditary ATTR amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the common mutations associated with hATTR.

patients.demographics: 12 males and 10 females, predominantly native Austrians

individual_records.evidence_sentence: the presence of cardiomyopathy in our patient, as well as its ultrarare occurrence in databases and its location within the gene beside clearly pathogenetic variants favor a possible disease-causing role of this variant.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is of uncertain significance but associated with cardiomyopathy.
